title: Channel Islands National Park: 2014 Archived Lecture Videos
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     From Shore to Sea Lectures     2014 Archived Lecture Videos                  2014 "From Shore to Sea" Archived Lecture Videos      Please note that there are only six lectures in the 2014 series: March, April, May, September, October, and November.             The Songbirds of the Channel Islands   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:45 minutes, 22 seconds  Smithsonian biologist Scott Sillett discussed island songbirds during the March From Shore to Sea lecture.NOTE: This video was not filmed by the park's audio visual staff and the production quality does not meet our standards. However, since we have received requests for this lecture we are posting it for the public to view.                Research at the New Santa Rosa Island Field Station   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:53 minutes, 34 seconds  The new Santa Rosa Island Research Station manager Cause Hanna outlined research plans for California State University, Channel Islands during the From Shore to Sea lecture in April.               The Channel Islands Biological Survey 1939-1941   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:44 minutes, 55 seconds  Channel Islands National Park welcomed Corinne Heyning Laverty for a special lecture in May about the history of the Channel Islands Biological Survey. Noteworthy discoveries of the survey include the "Lone Woman's" whalebone hut on San Nicolas Island and Big Dog Cave on San Clemente Island               A History of Aviation in the Northern Channel Islands   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 8 minutes, 17 seconds  Dr. Charles Rennie discussed the history of aviation on the northern Channel Islands during the September From Shore to Sea lecture.               Peregrine Falcons on the Channel Islands   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:54 minutes, 46 seconds  Biologist Dr. Peter Sharpe with the Institute for Wildlife Studies discussed the recovery of peregrine falcons on the California Channel Islands during the October From Shore to Sea lecture.               Botany of Guadalupe Island   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 8 minutes, 20 seconds  Channel Islands National Park hosted a lecture about the botanical riches of Guadalupe Island by noted island plant biologist Steve Junak during the November 12, 2014 From Shore to Sea Lecture.
